thread.title: Cory Bernardi warns Malcolm Turnbull of fresh leadership talk in defection phone call
thread.title_full: Cory Bernardi warns Malcolm Turnbull of fresh leadership talk in defection phone call

author: Latika Bourke
title: Cory Bernardi warns Malcolm Turnbull of fresh leadership talk in defection phone call
text:
Chief scientist goes off at Trump Chief scientist goes off at Trump 
Science is under attack, says Australia's chief scientist Adam Finkel, who has likened Donald Trump to Stalin. Video courtesy: ANU More videos Is senator Corey Bernardi about to defect? 
There is speculation Liberal senator Cory Bernardi is set to leave the Coalition to create his own conservative movement. 
According to sources, Mr Turnbull asked Senator Bernardi the reasons for his departure just seven months after being re-elected for a six-year term to represent the Liberal Party in South Australia. Senator Bernardi replied he would explain his reasons to the public on Tuesday. 
Ominously, Senator Bernardi warned Mr Turnbull that moves were afoot to displace him because of his own poor performance in the polls â€“ a reason the Prime Minister used to justify his 2015 move against Mr Abbott. Related Content Cory Bernardi to rock first day of Parliament by resigning from the Turnbull government 
"There's talk about doing it again and I want no part of it," Senator Bernardi told Mr Turnbull, according to colleagues. 
Senator Bernardi warned against the 2015 leadership change, saying copying Labor's hit on Kevin Rudd would only solidify the perception that the Liberal Party was no different to their political enemies. Advertisement 
While there is disquiet in government ranks and widespread gloom about the Coalition's position in the polls, there are no imminent moves to replace Mr Turnbull. 
Senator Bernardi has previously made it clear that as an independent on the crossbench he would not disrupt the government's agenda but seek to improve Liberal Party policies with "conservatism and commonsense." SHARE
